<h3 class="heading settled" data-level="3.2" id="sizing-values"><span class="secno">3.2. </span><span class="content"> New Sizing Values: the <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="#valdef-width-stretch" id="ref-for-valdef-width-stretch">stretch</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="#valdef-width-fit-content" id="ref-for-valdef-width-fit-content">fit-content</a>, and <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="#valdef-width-contain" id="ref-for-valdef-width-contain">contain</a> keywords</span><span id="width-height-keywords"></span><a class="self-link" href="#sizing-values"></a></h3>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="3">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<table class="def propdef partial" data-link-for-hint="width">
    <tbody>
     <tr>
      <th>Name:
      <td><a class="css" data-link-type="property" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#propdef-width" id="ref-for-propdef-width①">width</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="property" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#propdef-height" id="ref-for-propdef-height①">height</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="property" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-logical-1/#propdef-inline-size" id="ref-for-propdef-inline-size">inline-size</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="property" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-logical-1/#propdef-block-size" id="ref-for-propdef-block-size">block-size</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="property" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#propdef-min-width" id="ref-for-propdef-min-width①">min-width</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="property" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#propdef-min-height" id="ref-for-propdef-min-height①">min-height</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="property" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-logical-1/#propdef-min-inline-size" id="ref-for-propdef-min-inline-size">min-inline-size</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="property" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-logical-1/#propdef-min-block-size" id="ref-for-propdef-min-block-size">min-block-size</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="property" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#propdef-max-width" id="ref-for-propdef-max-width①">max-width</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="property" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#propdef-max-height" id="ref-for-propdef-max-height①">max-height</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="property" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-logical-1/#propdef-max-inline-size" id="ref-for-propdef-max-inline-size">max-inline-size</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="property" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-logical-1/#propdef-max-block-size" id="ref-for-propdef-max-block-size">max-block-size</a>
     <tr class="value">
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values/#value-defs">New values:</a>
      <td class="prod">stretch <a data-link-type="grammar" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#comb-one" id="ref-for-comb-one">|</a> fit-content <span id="ref-for-comb-one①">|</span> contain 
   </table>
   <dl>
    <dt><dfn class="dfn-paneled css" data-dfn-for="width, height, inline-size, block-size, min-width, min-height, min-inline-size, min-block-size, max-width, max-height, max-inline-size, max-block-size" data-dfn-type="value" data-export id="valdef-width-stretch">stretch</dfn> 
    <dd> Applies <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#stretch-fit-size" id="ref-for-stretch-fit-size">stretch-fit sizing</a>,
			attempting to match the size of the box’s <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-box-4/#margin-box" id="ref-for-margin-box">margin box</a> to the size of its <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#containing-block" id="ref-for-containing-block">containing block</a>.
			See <a href="#stretch-fit-sizing">§ 6.1 Stretch-fit Sizing: filling the containing block</a>. 
    <dt><dfn class="dfn-paneled css" data-dfn-for="width, height, inline-size, block-size, min-width, min-height, min-inline-size, min-block-size, max-width, max-height, max-inline-size, max-block-size" data-dfn-type="value" data-export id="valdef-width-fit-content">fit-content</dfn> 
    <dd> Essentially <span class="css">fit-content(stretch)</span> i.e. min(<a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#valdef-width-max-content" id="ref-for-valdef-width-max-content">max-content</a>, max(<a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#valdef-width-min-content" id="ref-for-valdef-width-min-content">min-content</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="#valdef-width-stretch" id="ref-for-valdef-width-stretch①">stretch</a>)). 
    <dt><dfn class="dfn-paneled css" data-dfn-for="width, height, inline-size, block-size, min-width, min-height, min-inline-size, min-block-size, max-width, max-height, max-inline-size, max-block-size" data-dfn-type="value" data-export id="valdef-width-contain">contain</dfn> 
    <dd>
      If the box has a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio">preferred aspect ratio</a>,
			applies <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#contain-fit-sizing" id="ref-for-contain-fit-sizing">contain-fit sizing</a>,
			attempting to fit into the box’s constraints
			while maintaining its <span id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio①">preferred aspect ratio</span> insofar as possible.
			See <a href="#contain-fit-sizing" id="ref-for-contain-fit-sizing①">§ 6.2 Contain-fit Sizing: stretching while maintaining an aspect ratio</a>. 
     <p>If the box has no <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio②">preferred aspect ratio</a>,
			applies <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#stretch-fit-size" id="ref-for-stretch-fit-size①">stretch-fit sizing</a>.</p>
   </dl>

</details>
<h2 class="heading settled" data-level="4" id="ratios"><span class="secno">4. </span><span class="content"> Aspect Ratios</span><a class="self-link" href="#ratios"></a></h2>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="2">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<p>Images often have a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-images-3/#natural-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-natural-aspect-ratio">natural aspect ratio</a>,
	which the CSS layout algorithms attempt to preserve
	as they resize the element.</p>
   <p>The <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-propdef-aspect-ratio">aspect-ratio</a> property allows specifying this behavior
	for non-replaced elements,
	and for altering the effective aspect ratio of replaced elements.</p>
   <p class="issue" id="issue-cce77cb6"><a class="self-link" href="#issue-cce77cb6"></a> We are still working through the details of this section.
	If there is any behavior specified here
	that would cause <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#replaced-element" id="ref-for-replaced-element">replaced elements</a> with a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio③">preferred aspect ratio</a> to behave differently than they would
	under the requirements of the <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html">CSS2</a>, <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-flexbox-1/">Flex Layout</a>,
	and <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-grid-1/">Grid Layout</a> specs combined (without this specification in effect), <strong>this is an error and should be <a href="https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues">reported</a> to the CSSWG</strong>.</p>

</details>
<h3 class="heading settled" data-level="4.1" id="aspect-ratio"><span class="secno">4.1. </span><span class="content"> Preferred Aspect Ratios: the <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-propdef-aspect-ratio①">aspect-ratio</a> property</span><a class="self-link" href="#aspect-ratio"></a></h3>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="3">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<table class="def propdef" data-link-for-hint="aspect-ratio">
    <tbody>
     <tr>
      <th>Name:
      <td><dfn class="dfn-paneled css" data-dfn-type="property" data-export id="propdef-aspect-ratio">aspect-ratio</dfn>
     <tr class="value">
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values/#value-defs">Value:</a>
      <td class="prod">auto <a data-link-type="grammar" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#comb-any" id="ref-for-comb-any">||</a> <a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#ratio-value" id="ref-for-ratio-value">&lt;ratio></a> 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade/#initial-values">Initial:</a>
      <td>auto 
     <tr>
      <th>Applies to:
      <td>all elements except <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#inline-box" id="ref-for-inline-box">inline boxes</a> and internal ruby or table boxes 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade/#inherited-property">Inherited:</a>
      <td>no 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values/#percentages">Percentages:</a>
      <td>n/a 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade/#computed">Computed value:</a>
      <td>specified keyword or a pair of numbers 
     <tr>
      <th>Canonical order:
      <td>per grammar 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/web-animations/#animation-type">Animation type:</a>
      <td>by computed value 
   </table>
   <p>This property sets a <dfn class="dfn-paneled" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-export id="preferred-aspect-ratio">preferred aspect ratio</dfn> for the box,
	which will be used in the calculation of <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#valdef-width-auto" id="ref-for-valdef-width-auto">auto</a> sizes
	and some other layout functions.</p>
   <dl>
    <dt><dfn class="dfn-paneled css" data-dfn-for="aspect-ratio" data-dfn-type="value" data-export id="valdef-aspect-ratio-auto">auto</dfn> 
    <dd> <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#replaced-element" id="ref-for-replaced-element①">Replaced elements</a> with a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-images-3/#natural-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-natural-aspect-ratio①">natural aspect ratio</a> use that aspect ratio;
			otherwise the box has no <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio④">preferred aspect ratio</a>.
			Size calculations involving the aspect ratio
			work with the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-box-4/#content-box" id="ref-for-content-box">content box</a> dimensions always. 
    <dt><dfn class="css" data-dfn-for="aspect-ratio" data-dfn-type="value" data-export id="valdef-aspect-ratio-ratio"><a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#ratio-value" id="ref-for-ratio-value①">&lt;ratio></a><a class="self-link" href="#valdef-aspect-ratio-ratio"></a></dfn> 
    <dd>
      The box’s <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio⑤">preferred aspect ratio</a> is the specified ratio
			of <span class="css">width / height</span>.
			Size calculations involving the aspect ratio
			work with the dimensions of the box specified by <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#propdef-box-sizing" id="ref-for-propdef-box-sizing">box-sizing</a>. 
     <p>If the <a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#ratio-value" id="ref-for-ratio-value②">&lt;ratio></a> is <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#degenerate-ratio" id="ref-for-degenerate-ratio">degenerate</a>,
			the property instead behaves as <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="#valdef-aspect-ratio-auto" id="ref-for-valdef-aspect-ratio-auto">auto</a>.</p>
    <dt><dfn class="css" data-dfn-for="aspect-ratio" data-dfn-type="value" data-export id="valdef-aspect-ratio-auto--ratio">auto &amp;&amp; <a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#ratio-value" id="ref-for-ratio-value③">&lt;ratio></a><a class="self-link" href="#valdef-aspect-ratio-auto--ratio"></a></dfn> 
    <dd>
      If both <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="#valdef-aspect-ratio-auto" id="ref-for-valdef-aspect-ratio-auto①">auto</a> and a <a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#ratio-value" id="ref-for-ratio-value④">&lt;ratio></a> are specified together,
			the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio⑥">preferred aspect ratio</a> is the specified ratio
			of <span class="css">width / height</span> unless it is a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#replaced-element" id="ref-for-replaced-element②">replaced element</a> with a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-images-3/#natural-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-natural-aspect-ratio②">natural aspect ratio</a>,
			in which case that aspect ratio is used instead.
			In all cases, size calculations involving the aspect ratio
			work with the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-box-4/#content-box" id="ref-for-content-box①">content box</a> dimensions always. 
     <p>If the <a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#ratio-value" id="ref-for-ratio-value⑤">&lt;ratio></a> is <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#degenerate-ratio" id="ref-for-degenerate-ratio①">degenerate</a>,
			the property instead behaves as <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="#valdef-aspect-ratio-auto" id="ref-for-valdef-aspect-ratio-auto②">auto</a>.</p>
   </dl>
   <p class="note" role="note"><span>Note:</span> Having a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio⑦">preferred aspect ratio</a> does not make a box into a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#replaced-element" id="ref-for-replaced-element③">replaced element</a>;
	layout rules specific to <span id="ref-for-replaced-element④">replaced elements</span> do not generally apply to <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#non-replaced" id="ref-for-non-replaced">non-replaced</a> boxes with a <span id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio⑧">preferred aspect ratio</span>.
	For example, a <span id="ref-for-non-replaced①">non-replaced</span> <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-position-3/#absolute-position" id="ref-for-absolute-position">absolutely-positioned</a> box
	treats <a class="css" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-align-3/#propdef-justify-self" id="ref-for-propdef-justify-self">justify-self: normal</a> as <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-align-3/#valdef-justify-self-stretch" id="ref-for-valdef-justify-self-stretch">stretch</a>, not as <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://drafts.csswg.org/css-align-3/#valdef-self-position-start" id="ref-for-valdef-self-position-start">start</a> (<a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-align-3/#justify-abspos">CSS Box Alignment 3 §6.1.2 Absolutely-Positioned Boxes</a>),
	even if it has a <span id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio⑨">preferred aspect ratio</span></p>
   <p class="issue" id="issue-ada2dbb9"><a class="self-link" href="#issue-ada2dbb9"></a> CSS2.1 does not cleanly differentiate between
	replaced elements vs. elements with an aspect ratio;
	need to figure out specific cases that are unclear and define them,
	either in the appropriate Level 3 spec or here.</p>
   <div class="example" id="example-95a95149">
    <a class="self-link" href="#example-95a95149"></a> This example sets each item in the grid to render as a square,
		determining the number of items and their widths by the available space. 
<pre class="highlight"><c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>ul</c-><c- p>></c->
  <c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>li</c-><c- p>></c->…
  <c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>li</c-><c- p>></c->…
  <c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>li</c-><c- p>></c->…
  <c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>li</c-><c- p>></c->…
<c- p>&lt;/</c-><c- f>ul</c-><c- p>></c->
</pre>
<pre class="highlight">ul <c- p>{</c->
  <c- k>display</c-><c- p>:</c-> grid<c- p>;</c->
  <c- k>grid-template-columns</c-><c- p>:</c-> <c- nf>repeat</c-><c- p>(</c->auto-fill<c- p>,</c-> <c- nf>minmax</c-><c- p>(</c-><c- m>12</c-><c- k>em</c-><c- p>,</c-> <c- m>1</c-><c- k>fr</c-><c- p>));</c->
<c- p>}</c->
li <c- p>{</c->
  <c- k>aspect-ratio</c-><c- p>:</c-> <c- m>1</c->/<c- m>1</c-><c- p>;</c->
  <c- k>overflow</c-><c- p>:</c-> auto<c- p>;</c->
<c- p>}</c->
</pre>
   </div>
   <div class="example" id="example-2993b4a0">
    <a class="self-link" href="#example-2993b4a0"></a> This example uses the <code><a data-link-type="element" href="https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/iframe-embed-object.html#the-iframe-element" id="ref-for-the-iframe-element">iframe</a></code> element’s <code>width</code> and <code>height</code> attributes
		to set the <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-propdef-aspect-ratio②">aspect-ratio</a> property,
		giving the iframe an aspect ratio to use for sizing
		so that it behaves exactly like an image with that aspect ratio. 
<pre class="highlight"><c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>iframe</c->
  <c- e>src</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>"https://www.youtube.com/embed/0Gr1XSyxZy0"</c->
  <c- e>width</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>560</c->
  <c- e>height</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>315</c-><c- p>></c->
</pre>
<pre class="highlight"><c- n>@supports</c-> <c- p>(</c->aspect-ratio: <c- nf>attr</c-><c- p>(</c->width number<c- p>)</c-> / <c- m>1</c-><c- p>)</c-> <c- p>{</c->
  iframe <c- p>{</c->
    <c- k>aspect-ratio</c-><c- p>:</c-> <c- nf>attr</c-><c- p>(</c->width number<c- p>)</c-> / <c- nf>attr</c-><c- p>(</c->height number<c- p>);</c->
    <c- k>width</c-><c- p>:</c-> <c- m>100</c-><c- k>%</c-><c- p>;</c->
    <c- k>height</c-><c- p>:</c-> auto<c- p>;</c->
  <c- p>}</c->
<c- p>}</c->
</pre>
   </div>
   <p>If a replaced element’s only <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-images-3/#natural-dimensions" id="ref-for-natural-dimensions">natural dimension</a> is a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-images-3/#natural-width" id="ref-for-natural-width">natural width</a> or a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-images-3/#natural-height" id="ref-for-natural-height">natural height</a>,
	giving it a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio①⓪">preferred aspect ratio</a> also gives it an <span id="ref-for-natural-dimensions①">natural</span> height or width,
	whichever was missing,
	by transferring the existing size
	through the <span id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio①①">preferred aspect ratio</span>.</p>

</details>
<h3 class="heading settled" data-level="4.2" id="aspect-ratio-automatic"><span class="secno">4.2. </span><span class="content"> Effects of Preferred Aspect Ratio on Automatic Sizes</span><a class="self-link" href="#aspect-ratio-automatic"></a></h3>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="3">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<p>When a box has a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio①②">preferred aspect ratio</a>,
	its <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#automatic-size" id="ref-for-automatic-size">automatic sizes</a> are calculated the same as for
	a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#replaced-element" id="ref-for-replaced-element⑤">replaced element</a> with a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-images-3/#natural-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-natural-aspect-ratio③">natural aspect ratio</a> and no <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-images-3/#natural-size" id="ref-for-natural-size">natural size</a> in that axis,
	see e.g. <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html">CSS2 § 10</a> and <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-flexbox-1/#algo-main-item">CSS Flexible Box Model Level 1 § 9.2</a>.
	The axis in which the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#preferred-size" id="ref-for-preferred-size">preferred size</a> calculation
	depends on this aspect ratio
	is called the <dfn class="dfn-paneled" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-export id="ratio-dependent-axis">ratio-dependent axis</dfn>,
	and the resulting size is <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#definite" id="ref-for-definite">definite</a> if its input sizes are also <span id="ref-for-definite①">definite</span>.
	The opposite axis (on which the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#ratio-dependent-axis" id="ref-for-ratio-dependent-axis">ratio-dependent axis</a> size depends)
	is the <dfn class="dfn-paneled" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-export id="ratio-determining-axis">ratio-determining axis</dfn>.</p>
   <p class="note" role="note"><span>Note:</span> A <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio①③">preferred aspect ratio</a> only ever has an effect if at least one of the box’s sizes
	is <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#automatic-size" id="ref-for-automatic-size①">automatic</a>.
	If neither <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#propdef-width" id="ref-for-propdef-width②">width</a> nor <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#propdef-height" id="ref-for-propdef-height②">height</a> is an <span id="ref-for-automatic-size②">automatic size</span>,
	it can have no effect on its <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#preferred-size" id="ref-for-preferred-size①">preferred sizes</a>.</p>
   <p class="issue" id="issue-36f34fa3"><a class="self-link" href="#issue-36f34fa3"></a> When we move all the sizing information here,
	rather than crowbar-ing our way into 2.1,
	then the core principle here is just:
	the resolved <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#preferred-size" id="ref-for-preferred-size②">preferred size</a> in the ratio-determining axis
	(before applying min/max)
	gets transferred thru the ratio.
	Min/max constraints get transferred afterwards,
	and then applied to each axis independently without regards to aspect-ratio.</p>
   <h4 class="heading settled" data-level="4.2.1" id="aspect-ratio-margin-collapse"><span class="secno">4.2.1. </span><span class="content"> Margin-collapsing</span><a class="self-link" href="#aspect-ratio-margin-collapse"></a></h4>
   <p>For the purpose of margin collapsing (<a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/box.html#collapsing-margins">CSS 2 §8.3.1 Collapsing margins</a>),
	if the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-writing-modes-4/#block-axis" id="ref-for-block-axis">block axis</a> is the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#ratio-dependent-axis" id="ref-for-ratio-dependent-axis①">ratio-dependent axis</a>,
	it is not considered to have a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade-5/#computed-value" id="ref-for-computed-value">computed</a> <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-logical-1/#propdef-block-size" id="ref-for-propdef-block-size①">block-size</a> of <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#valdef-width-auto" id="ref-for-valdef-width-auto①">auto</a>.</p>

</details>
<h3 class="heading settled" data-level="4.3" id="aspect-ratio-minimum"><span class="secno">4.3. </span><span class="content"> Automatic Content-based Minimum Sizes</span><a class="self-link" href="#aspect-ratio-minimum"></a></h3>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="3">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<p>In order to avoid unintentional overflow,
	the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#automatic-minimum-size" id="ref-for-automatic-minimum-size">automatic minimum size</a> in the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#ratio-dependent-axis" id="ref-for-ratio-dependent-axis②">ratio-dependent axis</a> of a box with a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio①④">preferred aspect ratio</a> that is neither a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#replaced-element" id="ref-for-replaced-element⑥">replaced element</a> nor a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-overflow-3/#scroll-container" id="ref-for-scroll-container">scroll container</a> is its <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#min-content" id="ref-for-min-content">min-content size</a> capped by its <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#max-width" id="ref-for-max-width">maximum size</a>.</p>
   <div class="example" id="example-514390d4">
    <a class="self-link" href="#example-514390d4"></a> In the following example,
		the box is as wide as the container (as usual),
		and its height is as tall as needed to contain its content
		but at least as tall as it is wide. 
<pre class="highlight">div <c- p>{</c->
  <c- k>aspect-ratio</c-><c- p>:</c-> <c- m>1</c->/<c- m>1</c-><c- p>;</c->
  <c- c>/* 'width' and 'height' both default to 'auto' */</c->
<c- p>}</c->
</pre>
<pre class="figure">+----------+  +----------+  +----------+
| ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |
| ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |
| ~~~~~~~  |  | ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |
|          |  | ~~~      |  | ~~~~~~~~ |
+----------+  +----------+  | ~~~~~~~~ |
                            | ~~~~~~   |
                            +----------+
</pre>
    <p>When <a class="css" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-overflow-3/#propdef-overflow" id="ref-for-propdef-overflow">overflow: auto</a> is specified, however,
		even the box with excess content maintains the 1:1 aspect ratio
		(and handles overflow by becoming scrollable instead, as usual).</p>
<pre class="highlight">div <c- p>{</c->
  <c- k>overflow</c-><c- p>:</c-> auto<c- p>;</c->
  <c- k>aspect-ratio</c-><c- p>:</c-> <c- m>1</c->/<c- m>1</c-><c- p>;</c->
<c- p>}</c->
</pre>
<pre class="figure">+----------+  +----------+  +----------+
| ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~^|
| ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |
| ~~~~~~~  |  | ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |
|          |  | ~~~      |  | ~~~~~~~~v|
+----------+  +----------+  +----------+
</pre>
    <p>Overriding the <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#propdef-min-height" id="ref-for-propdef-min-height②">min-height</a> property also maintains the 1:1 aspect ratio,
		but will result in content overflowing the box
		if it is not otherwise handled.</p>
<pre class="highlight">div <c- p>{</c->
  <c- k>aspect-ratio</c-><c- p>:</c-> <c- m>1</c->/<c- m>1</c-><c- p>;</c->
  <c- k>min-height</c-><c- p>:</c-> <c- m>0</c-><c- p>;</c->
<c- p>}</c->
</pre>
<pre class="figure">+----------+  +----------+  +----------+
| ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |
| ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |
| ~~~~~~~  |  | ~~~~~~~~ |  | ~~~~~~~~ |
|          |  | ~~~      |  | ~~~~~~~~ |
+----------+  +----------+  +-~~~~~~~~-+
                              ~~~~~~    
</pre>
   </div>
   <div class="example" id="example-63716969">
    <a class="self-link" href="#example-63716969"></a> This automatic minimum operates in both axes.
		Consider this example: 
<pre class="highlight"><c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>div</c-> <c- e>style</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>"height: 100px; aspect-ratio: 1/1;"</c-><c- p>></c->
  <c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>span</c-> <c- e>style</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>"display: inline-block; width: 50px;"</c-><c- p>>&lt;/</c-><c- f>span</c-><c- p>></c->
  <c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>span</c-> <c- e>style</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>"display: inline-block; width: 150px;"</c-><c- p>>&lt;/</c-><c- f>span</c-><c- p>></c->
<c- p>&lt;/</c-><c- f>div</c-><c- p>></c->
</pre>
    <p>The <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#propdef-width" id="ref-for-propdef-width③">width</a> of the container, being <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#valdef-width-auto" id="ref-for-valdef-width-auto②">auto</a>,
		resolves through the aspect ratio to 100px.
		However, its <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#propdef-min-width" id="ref-for-propdef-min-width②">min-width</a>, being <span class="css" id="ref-for-valdef-width-auto③">auto</span>,
		resolves to 150px.
		The resulting width of the container is thus 150px.
		To ignore the contents when sizing the container, <span class="css" id="ref-for-propdef-min-width③">min-width: 0</span> can be specified.</p>
   </div>

</details>
<h3 class="heading settled" data-level="4.4" id="aspect-ratio-size-transfers"><span class="secno">4.4. </span><span class="content"> Min/Max Size Transfers</span><a class="self-link" href="#aspect-ratio-size-transfers"></a></h3>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="3">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<p>Sizing constraints in either axis
	(the <var>origin</var> axis)
	are transferred through the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio①⑤">preferred aspect ratio</a> and applied to any <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#indefinite" id="ref-for-indefinite">indefinite</a> <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#min-width" id="ref-for-min-width">minimum</a>, <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#max-width" id="ref-for-max-width①">maximum</a>, or <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#preferred-size" id="ref-for-preferred-size③">preferred</a> size
	in the other axis (the <var>destination</var> axis)
	as follows:</p>
   <ul>
    <li data-md>
     <p>First, any <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#definite" id="ref-for-definite②">definite</a> <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#min-width" id="ref-for-min-width①">minimum size</a> is converted and transferred
from the <var>origin</var> to <var>destination</var> axis.
This transferred minimum is capped
by any <span id="ref-for-definite③">definite</span> <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#preferred-size" id="ref-for-preferred-size④">preferred</a> or <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#max-width" id="ref-for-max-width②">maximum size</a> in the <var>destination</var> axis.</p>
    <li data-md>
     <p>Then, any <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#definite" id="ref-for-definite④">definite</a> <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#max-width" id="ref-for-max-width③">maximum size</a> is converted and transferred
from the <var>origin</var> to <var>destination</var>.
This transferred maximum is floored
by any <span id="ref-for-definite⑤">definite</span> <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#preferred-size" id="ref-for-preferred-size⑤">preferred</a> or <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#min-width" id="ref-for-min-width②">minimum size</a> in the <var>destination</var> axis
as well as by the transferred minimum, if any.</p>
   </ul>
   <p class="note" role="note"><span>Note:</span> Thus, any definite sizes are completely unaffected by a transferred constraint;
	and a transferred minimum will never cause an element to exceed a definite preferred/maximum size,
	nor will a transferred maximum cause an element to violate its preferred/minimum size.</p>
   <p class="note" role="note"><span>Note:</span> The basic principle is that sizing constraints
	transfer through the aspect-ratio to the other side
	to preserve the aspect ratio to the extent that they can
	without violating any sizes specified explicitly on that affected axis.
	(This is the principle that drove the contents of
	the <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#min-max-widths">constraint table in CSS2 Section 10.4</a>.)</p>
   <div class="example" id="example-b98c11d1">
    <a class="self-link" href="#example-b98c11d1"></a> In the following example: 
<pre class="highlight"><c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>div</c-> <c- e>id</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>container</c-> <c- e>style</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>"height: 100px; float: left;"</c-><c- p>></c->
  <c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>div</c-> <c- e>id</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>item</c-> <c- e>style</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>"height: 100%; aspect-ratio: 1/1;"</c-><c- p>></c->content<c- p>&lt;/</c-><c- f>div</c-><c- p>></c->
<c- p>&lt;/</c-><c- f>div</c-><c- p>></c->
</pre>
    <p>Since the height of the <code>#item</code> is a percentage that resolves against a definite container,
		the width of the item resolves to 100px for both its intrinsic size contributions as well as for final layout,
		so the container also sizes to a width of 100px.</p>
<pre class="highlight"><c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>div</c-> <c- e>id</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>container</c-> <c- e>style</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>"height: auto; float: left;"</c-><c- p>></c->
  <c- p>&lt;</c-><c- f>div</c-> <c- e>id</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>item</c-> <c- e>style</c-><c- o>=</c-><c- s>"height: 100%; aspect-ratio: 1/1;"</c-><c- p>></c->content<c- p>&lt;/</c-><c- f>div</c-><c- p>></c->
<c- p>&lt;/</c-><c- f>div</c-><c- p>></c->
</pre>
    <p>In this next example,
		the percentage height of the item cannot be resolved and <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#behave-as-auto" id="ref-for-behave-as-auto">behaves as auto</a> (see <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#the-height-property">CSS 2 §10.5 Content height: the 'height' property</a>).
		Since both axes now have an <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#automatic-size" id="ref-for-automatic-size③">automatic size</a>,
		the height becomes the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#ratio-dependent-axis" id="ref-for-ratio-dependent-axis③">ratio-dependent axis</a>.
		Calculating the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#intrinsic-size-contribution" id="ref-for-intrinsic-size-contribution">intrinsic size contributions</a> of the box
		produces a width derived from its content,
		and a height calculated from that width and the aspect ratio,
		yielding a square box (and a container) sized
		to the width of the word “content”.</p>
   </div>
   <p class="issue" id="issue-0273742f"><a class="self-link" href="#issue-0273742f"></a> This section might not be written correctly. <a href="https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/6071">&lt;https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/6071></a></p>

</details>
<h2 class="heading settled" data-level="5" id="intrinsic"><span class="secno">5. </span><span class="content"> Intrinsic Size Determination</span><a class="self-link" href="#intrinsic"></a></h2>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="2">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>



</details>
<h3 class="heading settled" data-level="5.1" id="intrinsic-sizes"><span class="secno">5.1. </span><span class="content"> Intrinsic Sizes</span><a class="self-link" href="#intrinsic-sizes"></a></h3>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="3">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<p class="issue" id="issue-d41d8cd9②"><a class="self-link" href="#issue-d41d8cd9②"></a> <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#intrinsic-sizes">CSS Sizing 3 §5.1 Intrinsic Sizes</a></p>

</details>
<h3 class="heading settled" data-level="5.2" id="intrinsic-size-override"><span class="secno">5.2. </span><span class="content"> Overriding Contained Intrinsic Sizes: the <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc">contain-intrinsic-*</a> properties</span><a class="self-link" href="#intrinsic-size-override"></a></h3>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="3">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<table class="def propdef" data-link-for-hint="contain-intrinsic-width">
    <tbody>
     <tr>
      <th>Name:
      <td><dfn class="dfn-paneled css" data-dfn-type="property" data-export id="propdef-contain-intrinsic-width">contain-intrinsic-width</dfn>, <dfn class="dfn-paneled css" data-dfn-type="property" data-export id="propdef-contain-intrinsic-height">contain-intrinsic-height</dfn>, <dfn class="css" data-dfn-type="property" data-export id="propdef-contain-intrinsic-block-size">contain-intrinsic-block-size<a class="self-link" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-block-size"></a></dfn>, <dfn class="css" data-dfn-type="property" data-export id="propdef-contain-intrinsic-inline-size">contain-intrinsic-inline-size<a class="self-link" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-inline-size"></a></dfn>
     <tr class="value">
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values/#value-defs">Value:</a>
      <td class="prod">none <a data-link-type="grammar" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#comb-one" id="ref-for-comb-one②">|</a> <a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-3/#length-value" id="ref-for-length-value" title="Expands to: advance measure | cap | ch | cm | em | ex | ic | in | lh | mm | pc | pt | px | q | rem | rlh | vb | vh | vi | vmax | vmin | vw">&lt;length></a> <span id="ref-for-comb-one③">|</span> auto <a data-link-type="grammar" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#comb-all" id="ref-for-comb-all">&amp;&amp;</a> <span class="production" id="ref-for-length-value①" title="Expands to: advance measure | cap | ch | cm | em | ex | ic | in | lh | mm | pc | pt | px | q | rem | rlh | vb | vh | vi | vmax | vmin | vw">&lt;length></span> 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade/#initial-values">Initial:</a>
      <td>none 
     <tr>
      <th>Applies to:
      <td>elements with <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-contain-1/#size-containment" id="ref-for-size-containment">size containment</a> 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade/#inherited-property">Inherited:</a>
      <td>no 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values/#percentages">Percentages:</a>
      <td>n/a 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade/#computed">Computed value:</a>
      <td>as specified, with <a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-3/#length-value" id="ref-for-length-value②" title="Expands to: advance measure | cap | ch | cm | em | ex | ic | in | lh | mm | pc | pt | px | q | rem | rlh | vb | vh | vi | vmax | vmin | vw">&lt;length></a> values computed 
     <tr>
      <th>Canonical order:
      <td>per grammar 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/web-animations/#animation-type">Animation type:</a>
      <td>by computed value type 
   </table>
   <p>These properties allow elements with <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-contain-1/#size-containment" id="ref-for-size-containment①">size containment</a> to specify
	an <dfn class="dfn-paneled" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-export id="explicit-intrinsic-inner-size">explicit intrinsic inner size</dfn>,
	causing the box to size as if its in-flow content
	totals to a width and height
	matching the specified <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#explicit-intrinsic-inner-size" id="ref-for-explicit-intrinsic-inner-size">explicit intrinsic inner size</a> (rather than sizing as if it were empty).</p>
   <p class="note" role="note"><span>Note:</span> This is not always equivalent
	to laying out as if the element had one child of the specified <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#explicit-intrinsic-inner-size" id="ref-for-explicit-intrinsic-inner-size①">explicit intrinsic inner size</a>.
	For example, a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-grid-2/#grid-container" id="ref-for-grid-container">grid container</a> with one child of the specified size
	would still size according to the specified grid,
	usually ending up with a larger content size than specified.</p>
   <p>Values are defined as:</p>
   <dl>
    <dt data-md><dfn class="css" data-dfn-for="contain-intrinsic-width, contain-intrinsic-height, contain-intrinsic-block-size, contain-intrinsic-inline-size, contain-intrinsic-size" data-dfn-type="value" data-export id="valdef-contain-intrinsic-width-none">none<a class="self-link" href="#valdef-contain-intrinsic-width-none"></a></dfn>
    <dd data-md>
     <p>The corresponding axis does not have an <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#explicit-intrinsic-inner-size" id="ref-for-explicit-intrinsic-inner-size②">explicit intrinsic inner size</a>.</p>
    <dt data-md><dfn class="css" data-dfn-for="contain-intrinsic-width, contain-intrinsic-height, contain-intrinsic-block-size, contain-intrinsic-inline-size, contain-intrinsic-size" data-dfn-type="value" data-export id="valdef-contain-intrinsic-width-length"><a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-3/#length-value" id="ref-for-length-value③" title="Expands to: advance measure | cap | ch | cm | em | ex | ic | in | lh | mm | pc | pt | px | q | rem | rlh | vb | vh | vi | vmax | vmin | vw">&lt;length></a><a class="self-link" href="#valdef-contain-intrinsic-width-length"></a></dfn>
    <dd data-md>
     <p>The corresponding axis has an <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#explicit-intrinsic-inner-size" id="ref-for-explicit-intrinsic-inner-size③">explicit intrinsic inner size</a> of the specified <a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-3/#length-value" id="ref-for-length-value④" title="Expands to: advance measure | cap | ch | cm | em | ex | ic | in | lh | mm | pc | pt | px | q | rem | rlh | vb | vh | vi | vmax | vmin | vw">&lt;length></a>.</p>
    <dt data-md><dfn class="css" data-dfn-for="contain-intrinsic-width, contain-intrinsic-height, contain-intrinsic-block-size, contain-intrinsic-inline-size, contain-intrinsic-size" data-dfn-type="value" data-export id="valdef-contain-intrinsic-width-auto--length">auto &amp;&amp; <a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-3/#length-value" id="ref-for-length-value⑤" title="Expands to: advance measure | cap | ch | cm | em | ex | ic | in | lh | mm | pc | pt | px | q | rem | rlh | vb | vh | vi | vmax | vmin | vw">&lt;length></a><a class="self-link" href="#valdef-contain-intrinsic-width-auto--length"></a></dfn>
    <dd data-md>
     <p>The corresponding axis has an <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#explicit-intrinsic-inner-size" id="ref-for-explicit-intrinsic-inner-size④">explicit intrinsic inner size</a> of its <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#last-remembered" id="ref-for-last-remembered">last remembered size</a>.
If a <span id="ref-for-last-remembered①">last remembered size</span> does not yet exist,
instead use the specified <a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-3/#length-value" id="ref-for-length-value⑥" title="Expands to: advance measure | cap | ch | cm | em | ex | ic | in | lh | mm | pc | pt | px | q | rem | rlh | vb | vh | vi | vmax | vmin | vw">&lt;length></a>.</p>
   </dl>
   <p>If an element has an <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#explicit-intrinsic-inner-size" id="ref-for-explicit-intrinsic-inner-size⑤">explicit intrinsic inner size</a> in an axis,
	then after laying out the element as normal for <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-contain-1/#size-containment" id="ref-for-size-containment②">size containment</a>,
	the size of the contents in that axis are instead treated as being the <span id="ref-for-explicit-intrinsic-inner-size⑥">explicit intrinsic inner size</span> instead of what was calculated in layout,
	and layout is performed again if necessary.
	(If it has an <span id="ref-for-explicit-intrinsic-inner-size⑦">explicit intrinsic inner size</span> in both axises,
	this implies the first layout can be skipped.)</p>
   <p>These four properties are part of a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-logical-1/#logical-property-group" id="ref-for-logical-property-group">logical property group</a>.</p>
   <p class="note" role="note"><span>Note:</span> An element with <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-contain-1/#size-containment" id="ref-for-size-containment③">size containment</a> is laid out as if it had no contents <a data-link-type="biblio" href="#biblio-css-contain-1">[CSS-CONTAIN-1]</a>,
	which in many cases this will cause the element to collapse to zero inner height.
	This can be corrected with an explicit <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#propdef-height" id="ref-for-propdef-height③">height</a> chosen to show the expected contents,
	but that can have unintended effects in some layout systems,
	such as Flex and Grid Layout,
	which treat an explicit <span class="property" id="ref-for-propdef-height④">height</span> as a stronger command
	than an implicit content-based height.
	The element thus might lay out substantially differently than it would have
	were it simply filled with content up to that height.
	Providing an <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#explicit-intrinsic-inner-size" id="ref-for-explicit-intrinsic-inner-size⑧">explicit intrinsic inner size</a> for the element
	preserves the performance benefits of ignoring its contents for layout
	while still allowing it to size as if it had content.</p>
   <table class="def propdef" data-link-for-hint="contain-intrinsic-size">
    <tbody>
     <tr>
      <th>Name:
      <td><dfn class="dfn-paneled css" data-dfn-type="property" data-export id="propdef-contain-intrinsic-size">contain-intrinsic-size</dfn>
     <tr class="value">
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values/#value-defs">Value:</a>
      <td class="prod">[ none <a data-link-type="grammar" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#comb-one" id="ref-for-comb-one④">|</a> <a class="production css" data-link-type="type" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-3/#length-value" id="ref-for-length-value⑦" title="Expands to: advance measure | cap | ch | cm | em | ex | ic | in | lh | mm | pc | pt | px | q | rem | rlh | vb | vh | vi | vmax | vmin | vw">&lt;length></a> <span id="ref-for-comb-one⑤">|</span> auto <a data-link-type="grammar" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#comb-all" id="ref-for-comb-all①">&amp;&amp;</a> <span class="production" id="ref-for-length-value⑧" title="Expands to: advance measure | cap | ch | cm | em | ex | ic | in | lh | mm | pc | pt | px | q | rem | rlh | vb | vh | vi | vmax | vmin | vw">&lt;length></span> ]<a data-link-type="grammar" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#mult-num-range" id="ref-for-mult-num-range">{1,2}</a> 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade/#initial-values">Initial:</a>
      <td>see individual properties 
     <tr>
      <th>Applies to:
      <td>see individual properties 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade/#inherited-property">Inherited:</a>
      <td>see individual properties 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values/#percentages">Percentages:</a>
      <td>see individual properties 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade/#computed">Computed value:</a>
      <td>see individual properties 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/web-animations/#animation-type">Animation type:</a>
      <td>see individual properties 
     <tr>
      <th>Canonical order:
      <td>per grammar 
   </table>
   <p><a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-size" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-size">contain-intrinsic-size</a> is a shorthand property
	that sets the <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-width" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-width">contain-intrinsic-width</a> and <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-height" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-height">contain-intrinsic-height</a> properties.</p>
   <p>The first value represents the <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-width" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-width①">contain-intrinsic-width</a> value,
	and the second represents the <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-height" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-height①">contain-intrinsic-height</a> value.
	If only one value is given,
	it applies to both properties.</p>
   <h4 class="heading settled dfn-paneled" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-export data-level="5.2.1" data-lt="last remembered size" id="last-remembered"><span class="secno">5.2.1. </span><span class="content"> Last Remembered Size</span><a class="self-link" href="#last-remembered" id="ref-for-last-remembered⑤"></a></h4>
   <p><a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-contain-1/#size-containment" id="ref-for-size-containment④">Size containment</a> is very valuable for ensuring a page can render efficiently,
	restricting the scope of layout work that can happen
	as a result of an element changing its rendering.
	However, it’s also very restrictive for the author,
	requiring them to correctly predict what the size of the element will be;
	if this guess is incorrect,
	even slightly,
	it can cause unsightly scrollbars or accidentally-hidden content.</p>
   <p>The <a class="css" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-size" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-size①">contain-intrinsic-size: auto</a> value allows a middle-ground:
	if an element is ever <em>not</em> <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-contain-1/#size-containment" id="ref-for-size-containment⑤">size-contained</a>,
	this value causes the element to remember its size
	(calculated as normal by layout);
	then, if the element gains <span id="ref-for-size-containment⑥">size containment</span> later,
	it will use the remembered size,
	offering the performance benefits of <span id="ref-for-size-containment⑦">size containment</span> while <em>probably</em> sizing accurately to its contents.</p>
   <div class="algorithm" data-algorithm="last remembered size">
     The <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#last-remembered" id="ref-for-last-remembered②">last remembered size</a> of an element is determined by: 
    <ul>
     <li data-md>
      <p>At the time that ResizeObserver events are determined and delivered,
if an element has <a class="css" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-size" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-size②">contain-intrinsic-size: auto</a> but does not have <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-contain-1/#size-containment" id="ref-for-size-containment⑧">size containment</a>,
record its current inner dimensions
as its <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#last-remembered" id="ref-for-last-remembered③">last remembered size</a>.</p>
    </ul>
    <p>An element might not have a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#last-remembered" id="ref-for-last-remembered④">last remembered size</a>,
		if it has never been rendered without <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-contain-1/#size-containment" id="ref-for-size-containment⑨">size containment</a>.
		(In this case, it will instead use the fallback value
		provided along with <span class="css">auto</span>.)</p>
   </div>
   <h4 class="heading settled" data-level="5.2.2" id="cis-scrollbars"><span class="secno">5.2.2. </span><span class="content"> Interaction With <a class="css" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-overflow-3/#propdef-overflow" id="ref-for-propdef-overflow①">overflow: auto</a></span><a class="self-link" href="#cis-scrollbars"></a></h4>
   <p>The <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-size" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-size③">contain-intrinsic-size</a> property provides an estimate
	of how large the author expects the content of an element to be,
	but this estimate is not actual content
	and does not represent anything that needs to be shown to the user.
	Therefore, an element with <a class="css" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-overflow-3/#propdef-overflow" id="ref-for-propdef-overflow②">overflow: auto</a> must not generate scrollbars
	as a consequence of <span class="property" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-size④">contain-intrinsic-size</span>.</p>
   <p>However, if <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-size" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-size⑤">contain-intrinsic-size</a> indicates a size large enough
	that the element would generate scrollbars
	if it contained actual content of that size,
	then the element must be <em>sized</em> as if it generated those scrollbar(s)
	in accordance with such hypothetical content.</p>
   <div class="example" id="example-b57541eb">
    <a class="self-link" href="#example-b57541eb"></a> In the following example code: 
<pre class="highlight">div <c- p>{</c->
  <c- k>width</c-><c- p>:</c-> max-content<c- p>;</c->
  <c- k>contain-intrinsic-size</c-><c- p>:</c-> <c- m>100</c-><c- k>px</c-> <c- m>100</c-><c- k>px</c-><c- p>;</c->
  <c- k>overflow</c-><c- p>:</c-> auto<c- p>;</c->
<c- p>}</c->
</pre>
    <p>The element ends up being <span class="css">100px</span> wide and <span class="css">100px</span> tall: <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-size" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-size⑥">contain-intrinsic-size</a> provides the max-content width,
		and also the height.</p>
    <p>If the element then ended up with content that was <span class="css">150px</span> tall,
		it would show a vertical scrollbar;
		if the scrollbar is not overlay,
		it will take up some of that <span class="css">100px</span> width,
		leaving a smaller amount
		(roughly <span class="css">84px</span>, typically)
		for the content to flow into.
		(See <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-overflow-3/#scrollbar-layout">CSS Overflow 3 §3.2 Scrollbars and Layout</a>.)</p>
    <p>Even though there’s now less than <span class="css">100px</span> of horizontal space available for the content,
		it will not generate a horizontal scrollbar just because <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-size" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-size⑦">contain-intrinsic-size</a> indicates a <span class="css">100px</span> width;
		that would only happen if the actual content
		had something unbreakable
		and wider than the remaining space.</p>
   </div>
   <div class="example" id="example-577a9f87">
    <a class="self-link" href="#example-577a9f87"></a> In contrast, in the following example code: 
<pre class="highlight">div <c- p>{</c->
  <c- k>width</c-><c- p>:</c-> max-content<c- p>;</c->
  <c- k>contain-intrinsic-size</c-><c- p>:</c-> <c- m>100</c-><c- k>px</c-> <c- m>100</c-><c- k>px</c-><c- p>;</c->
  <c- k>height</c-><c- p>:</c-> <c- m>50</c-><c- k>px</c-><c- p>;</c->
  <c- k>overflow</c-><c- p>:</c-> auto<c- p>;</c->
<c- p>}</c->
</pre>
    <p>The element has a fixed <span class="css">50px</span> height,
		but <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-contain-intrinsic-size" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-size⑧">contain-intrinsic-size</a> indicates a <span class="css">100px</span> “estimated content height”.
		The element thus assumes that it will need a vertical scrollbar
		when it’s filled with actual content,
		resulting in a max-content width a little more than <span class="css">100px</span> (roughly <span class="css">116px</span>, typically),
		to accommodate the estimated <span class="css">100px</span> of max-content width from <span class="property" id="ref-for-propdef-contain-intrinsic-size⑨">contain-intrinsic-size</span>,
		and as well as the vertical scrollbar width (roughly <span class="css">16px</span>, typically).</p>
    <p>However, even though the element reserves space on the assumption of needing a scrollbar,
		it will not actually generate one
		unless the actual content overflows:
		if it ends up containing content that’s less than 50px tall,
		no vertical scrollbar will be generated at all,
		but the element will still be <span class="css">116px</span> wide.</p>
   </div>

</details>
<h3 class="heading settled" data-level="5.3" id="intrinsic-contribution"><span class="secno">5.3. </span><span class="content"> Intrinsic Size Contributions</span><a class="self-link" href="#intrinsic-contribution"></a></h3>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="3">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<p class="issue" id="issue-d41d8cd9③"><a class="self-link" href="#issue-d41d8cd9③"></a> <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#intrinsic-contribution">CSS Sizing 3 §5.2 Intrinsic Contributions</a></p>

</details>
<h3 class="heading settled" data-level="5.4" id="intrinsic-contribution-override"><span class="secno">5.4. </span><span class="content"> Zeroing Min-Content Size Contributions: the <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="#propdef-min-intrinsic-sizing" id="ref-for-propdef-min-intrinsic-sizing">min-intrinsic-sizing</a> property</span><a class="self-link" href="#intrinsic-contribution-override"></a></h3>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="3">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<table class="def propdef" data-link-for-hint="min-intrinsic-sizing">
    <tbody>
     <tr>
      <th>Name:
      <td><dfn class="dfn-paneled css" data-dfn-type="property" data-export id="propdef-min-intrinsic-sizing">min-intrinsic-sizing</dfn>
     <tr class="value">
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values/#value-defs">Value:</a>
      <td class="prod">legacy <a data-link-type="grammar" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#comb-one" id="ref-for-comb-one⑥">|</a> zero-if-scroll <a data-link-type="grammar" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values-4/#comb-any" id="ref-for-comb-any①">||</a> zero-if-extrinsic 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade/#initial-values">Initial:</a>
      <td>legacy 
     <tr>
      <th>Applies to:
      <td>all elements except <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#inline-box" id="ref-for-inline-box①">inline boxes</a> 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade/#inherited-property">Inherited:</a>
      <td>no 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-values/#percentages">Percentages:</a>
      <td>n/a 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade/#computed">Computed value:</a>
      <td>as specified 
     <tr>
      <th>Canonical order:
      <td>per grammar 
     <tr>
      <th><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/web-animations/#animation-type">Animation type:</a>
      <td>discrete 
   </table>
   <p class="issue" id="issue-b731f1ac"><a class="self-link" href="#issue-b731f1ac"></a> This property seriously needs some name bikeshedding.</p>
   <p>This property defines whether the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#min-content-contribution" id="ref-for-min-content-contribution">min-content contribution</a> of a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#non-replaced" id="ref-for-non-replaced②">non-replaced</a> box
	is “compressed” under certain circumstances.
	Values have the following meanings:</p>
   <dl>
    <dt><dfn class="css" data-dfn-for="min-intrinsic-size" data-dfn-type="value" data-export id="valdef-min-intrinsic-size-legacy">legacy<a class="self-link" href="#valdef-min-intrinsic-size-legacy"></a></dfn> 
    <dd> The box’s <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#min-content-contribution" id="ref-for-min-content-contribution①">min-content contribution</a> is handled as normal. 
    <dt><dfn class="dfn-paneled css" data-dfn-for="min-intrinsic-size" data-dfn-type="value" data-export id="valdef-min-intrinsic-size-zero-if-scroll">zero-if-scroll</dfn> 
    <dd> The box’s <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#min-content-contribution" id="ref-for-min-content-contribution②">min-content contribution</a> is “compressed” if it is a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-overflow-3/#scroll-container" id="ref-for-scroll-container①">scroll container</a>. 
    <dt><dfn class="css" data-dfn-for="min-intrinsic-size" data-dfn-type="value" data-export id="valdef-min-intrinsic-size-zero-if-extrinsic">zero-if-extrinsic<a class="self-link" href="#valdef-min-intrinsic-size-zero-if-extrinsic"></a></dfn> 
    <dd>
      The box’s <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#min-content-contribution" id="ref-for-min-content-contribution③">min-content contribution</a> is “compressed” if has an <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#extrinsic-sizing" id="ref-for-extrinsic-sizing">extrinsic</a> <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#preferred-size" id="ref-for-preferred-size⑥">preferred</a> or <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#max-width" id="ref-for-max-width④">maximum</a> size. 
     <p class="note" role="note"><span>Note:</span> This is the default behavior of most <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#replaced-element" id="ref-for-replaced-element⑦">replaced elements</a>.</p>
   </dl>
   <div class="example" id="example-3141cd7d">
    <a class="self-link" href="#example-3141cd7d"></a> The following rule will make all <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-overflow-3/#scroll-container" id="ref-for-scroll-container②">scroll containers</a> essentially ignore their contents
		when passing up their size contributions
		(unless they specifically requested a content-based size): 
<pre class="highlight">*<c- p>,</c-> ::before<c- p>,</c-> ::after <c- p>{</c-> <c- k>min-intrinsic-size</c-><c- p>:</c-> zero-if-scroll<c- p>;</c-> <c- p>}</c-></pre>
    <p>This prevents the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-overflow-3/#scroll-container" id="ref-for-scroll-container③">scroll container</a> from blowing up the size of its ancestors
		if it contains large items such as a table or long lines of unbreakable text.
		Meanwhile, it allows boxes that are not scroll containers
		to continue influencing the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#min-content" id="ref-for-min-content①">min-content size</a> of their ancestors.</p>
   </div>
   <p class="note" role="note"><span>Note:</span> The behavior of <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="#valdef-min-intrinsic-size-zero-if-scroll" id="ref-for-valdef-min-intrinsic-size-zero-if-scroll">zero-if-scroll</a> would have been a better default,
	but due to Web-compat, it cannot be the initial value. :(</p>
   <p>The “compressed” <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#min-content-contribution" id="ref-for-min-content-contribution④">min-content contributions</a> is calculated
	by pretending the box were empty,
	except when factoring in sizing constraints imposed by explicit <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#valdef-width-min-content" id="ref-for-valdef-width-min-content①">min-content</a>, <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#valdef-width-max-content" id="ref-for-valdef-width-max-content①">max-content</a>, and <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="#valdef-width-fit-content" id="ref-for-valdef-width-fit-content①">fit-content</a> values
	of the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#sizing-property" id="ref-for-sizing-property">sizing properties</a>.</p>

</details>
<h2 class="heading settled" data-level="6" id="extrinsic"><span class="secno">6. </span><span class="content"> Extrinsic Size Determination</span><a class="self-link" href="#extrinsic"></a></h2>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="2">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<p class="issue" id="issue-d41d8cd9④"><a class="self-link" href="#issue-d41d8cd9④"></a> <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#extrinsic">CSS Sizing 3 §4 Extrinsic Size Determination</a></p>

</details>
<h3 class="heading settled" data-level="6.1" id="stretch-fit-sizing"><span class="secno">6.1. </span><span class="content"> Stretch-fit Sizing: filling the containing block</span><a class="self-link" href="#stretch-fit-sizing"></a></h3>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="3">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<p>Stretch-fit sizing tries to set the box’s used size
	to the length necessary
	to make its outer size as close to filling the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#containing-block" id="ref-for-containing-block①">containing block</a> as possible
	while still respecting the constraints imposed by min-height/min-width/max-height/max-width.</p>
   <p>Formally, its behavior is the same as specifying an <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#automatic-size" id="ref-for-automatic-size④">automatic size</a> together with a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-align-3/#self-alignment-properties" id="ref-for-self-alignment-properties">self-alignment property</a> value of <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="#valdef-width-stretch" id="ref-for-valdef-width-stretch②">stretch</a> (in the relevant axis),
	except that the resulting box,
	which can end up not exactly fitting its <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-align-3/#alignment-container" id="ref-for-alignment-container">alignment container</a>,
	can be subsequently aligned by its actual <span id="ref-for-self-alignment-properties①">self-alignment property</span> value.</p>
   <p>Additionally,
	in <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#formatting-context" id="ref-for-formatting-context">formatting contexts</a> and axes in which the relevant <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-align-3/#self-alignment-properties" id="ref-for-self-alignment-properties②">self-alignment property</a> does not apply
	(such as the block axis in Block Layout, or the main axis in Flex Layout),
	in cases where a percentage size in that axis would resolve to a definite value,
	a <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#stretch-fit-size" id="ref-for-stretch-fit-size②">stretch-fit size</a> causes the box to attempt to fill its containing block—<wbr>behaving as <span class="css">100%</span> but applying the resulting size to its margin box
	instead of the box indicated by <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#propdef-box-sizing" id="ref-for-propdef-box-sizing①">box-sizing</a>.
	For this purpose, <span class="css">auto</span> margins are treated as zero,
	and furthermore, for <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#block-level-box" id="ref-for-block-level-box">block-level boxes</a> in particular,
	if its block-start/block-end <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-box-4/#margin" id="ref-for-margin">margin</a> would be adjoining to its parent’s block-start/block-end <span id="ref-for-margin①">margin</span> if its parent’s <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#sizing-property" id="ref-for-sizing-property①">sizing properties</a> all had their <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-cascade-5/#initial-value" id="ref-for-initial-value">initial values</a>,
	then its block-start/block-end <span id="ref-for-margin②">margin</span> is treated as zero.</p>
   <p class="note" role="note"><span>Note:</span> Consequently, if neither <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-align-3/#valdef-align-self-stretch" id="ref-for-valdef-align-self-stretch">stretch</a> alignment applies
	nor percentage sizing can resolve,
	then the box will resolve to its <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#automatic-size" id="ref-for-automatic-size⑤">automatic size</a>.</p>
   <div class="example" id="example-174ae518">
    <a class="self-link" href="#example-174ae518"></a> For example, given the following HTML representing two <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-display-3/#block-box" id="ref-for-block-box">block boxes</a>: 
<pre class="html">&lt;div class="outer">
  &lt;div class="inner">&lt;/div>
&lt;/div>
</pre>
    <p>In the following case,
		the <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#outer-size" id="ref-for-outer-size">outer height</a> of the inner box
		will exactly match the height of the outer box (200px),
		but its <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#inner-size" id="ref-for-inner-size">inner height</a> will be 20px less, to account for its margins.</p>
<pre>.outer { height: 200px; border: solid; }
.inner { height: stretch; margin: 10px; }
</pre>
    <p>In the following case,
		the height of the inner box
		will exactly match the height of the outer box (200px).
		The top margins will collapse,
		but the bottom margins do not collapse
		(because the bottom margin of a box is not adjoining
		to the bottom margin of a parent with a non-<a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#valdef-width-auto" id="ref-for-valdef-width-auto④">auto</a> height,
		see <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/box.html#collapsing-margins">CSS 2 §8.3.1 Collapsing margins</a>),
		and therefore the inner box’s bottom margin will be truncated.</p>
<pre>.outer { height: 200px; margin: 0; }
.inner { height: stretch; margin: 10px; }
</pre>
   </div>
   <div class="example" id="example-6aa0dfe9">
    <a class="self-link" href="#example-6aa0dfe9"></a> Similarly, <a class="css" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#propdef-width" id="ref-for-propdef-width④">width: stretch</a> causes the box to fill its container,
		being 20px narrower than the width of "some more text"
		(due to the 10px margin): 
<pre class="html">&lt;div class="outer">
  &lt;div class="inner">text&lt;/div>
&lt;/div>
some more text
</pre>
<pre>.outer { float: left; margin: 0; }
.inner { width: stretch; margin: 10px; }
</pre>
   </div>
   <div class="example" id="example-3a83f468">
    <a class="self-link" href="#example-3a83f468"></a> On the other hand,
		in this example the container’s height is indefinite,
		which would cause a percentage height on the child to <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#behave-as-auto" id="ref-for-behave-as-auto①">behave as auto</a>,
		so <a class="css" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#propdef-height" id="ref-for-propdef-height⑤">height: stretch</a> <span id="ref-for-behave-as-auto②">behaves as auto</span> as well. 
<pre>.outer { height: auto; margin: 0; }
.inner { height: stretch; margin: 10px; }
</pre>
   </div>

</details>
<h3 class="heading settled dfn-paneled" data-dfn-type="dfn" data-export data-level="6.2" data-lt="contain-fit sizing" id="contain-fit-sizing"><span class="secno">6.2. </span><span class="content"> Contain-fit Sizing: stretching while maintaining an aspect ratio</span><a class="self-link" href="#contain-fit-sizing" id="ref-for-contain-fit-sizing②"></a></h3>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="3">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<p>Contain-fit sizing essentially applies stretch-fit sizing,
	but reduces the size of the box in one axis
	to maintain the box’s <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio①⑥">preferred aspect ratio</a>,
	similar to the <a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-images-3/#valdef-object-fit-contain" id="ref-for-valdef-object-fit-contain">contain</a> keyword of the <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-images-3/#propdef-object-fit" id="ref-for-propdef-object-fit">object-fit</a> and <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-backgrounds-3/#propdef-background-size" id="ref-for-propdef-background-size">background-size</a> properties.</p>
   <p>First, a target rectangle is determined:</p>
   <ol>
    <li> The initial target rectangle is the size of the box’s containing block,
			with any indefinite size assumed as infinity.
			If both dimensions are indefinite,
			the initial target rectangle is set
			to match the outer edges of the box were it <a data-link-type="dfn" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#stretch-fit-size" id="ref-for-stretch-fit-size③">stretch-fit sized</a>. 
    <li> Next, if the box has a non-<a class="css" data-link-type="maybe" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/css-sizing-3/#valdef-max-width-none" id="ref-for-valdef-max-width-none">none</a> <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#propdef-max-width" id="ref-for-propdef-max-width②">max-width</a> or <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#propdef-max-height" id="ref-for-propdef-max-height②">max-height</a>,
			the target rectangle is clamped in the affected dimension
			to less than or equal to the “maximum size” of the box’s margin box,
			i.e. the size its margin box would be
			if the box was sized at its max-width/height.
			(Note that, consistent with normal <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visuren.html">box-sizing rules</a>,
			this “maximum size” is floored by the effects of the box’s <a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#propdef-min-width" id="ref-for-propdef-min-width④">min-width</a>/<a class="property" data-link-type="propdesc" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/visudet.html#propdef-min-height" id="ref-for-propdef-min-height③">min-height</a>.) 
    <li> Last, the target rectangle is reduced in one dimension
			by the minimum necessary for it to match the box’s <a data-link-type="dfn" href="#preferred-aspect-ratio" id="ref-for-preferred-aspect-ratio①⑦">preferred aspect ratio</a>. 
   </ol>
   <p>The contain-fit size in each dimension is
	the size that would result from stretch-fitting into the target rectangle.</p>
   <p class="issue" id="issue-6e598fc0"><a class="self-link" href="#issue-6e598fc0"></a> Copy whatever stretch-fit ends up doing wrt margin collapsing.</p>
   <p class="issue" id="issue-9d61aaed"><a class="self-link" href="#issue-9d61aaed"></a> If there is a minimum size in one dimension
	that would cause overflow of the target rectangle if the aspect ratio were honored,
	do we honor the aspect ratio or skew the image?
	If the former, we need a step similar to #2 that applies the relevant minimums.</p>

</details>
<h3 class="heading settled" data-level="6.3" id="percentage-sizing"><span class="secno">6.3. </span><span class="content"> Percentage Sizing</span><a class="self-link" href="#percentage-sizing"></a></h3>
<details class="valor-spec" data-level="3">
  <summary>Show spec text</summary>

<p>…</p>

</details>
